TopicTitle: [WIN] KSP Spacecraft Crawler v1.0.1 - Transfer craft between the VAB and SPH

Articles.Content:
The KSP Spacecraft Crawler is a simple to use, stand-alone WPF (Windows Presentation Foundation) application designed to copy a selected craft file from one building to another (e.g. from VAB to SPH) and make the necessary modifications to the newly created craft file.

Installation

Download here and run the installer contained within the zip. You can delete the zip once you're done.

Requirements

The application requires .NET 4.5 to run, which you can get from Microsoft here. If youÃ¢â‚¬â„¢re not sure whether you have .NET 4.5 installed, just try running the application first.

Craft Safety

This application will never modify, delete or overwrite any of your existing craft files. Protecting your prized creations is my highest design priority.

Source Code

You can download the source code here.

Edited November 11, 2013 by FritzsFleas
We can do exactly that without leaving KSP with the new subassembly mode!? No offense, it's nice you made a tool for it, especially using WPF, but we don't really need it?!

Subassembly won't transfer an entire craft as it requires an attachable part. It's also quite likely to mess up any struts and fuel lines in a complex craft. Whereas if you transfer the craft in it's entirety, it's far more likely to make the trip unscathed.

We can do exactly that without leaving KSP with the new subassembly mode!? No offense, it's nice you made a tool for it, especially using WPF, but we don't really need it?!

No, you can't. You can move boosters and such that way, but not an entire vehicle. Trying to move an entire vehicle via subassembly breaks EVERYTHING.

Editor Extensions has a key combination to change between SPH and VAB modes of construction. You don't actually switch facilities but it's quite fast and convenient. This is quite valuable and complete as a tool though.
Looks nice and I will enjoy testing it. Thanks for taking the time and effort to make something for the KSP community.
